result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J Pirtle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:42 a.m. Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard today are 14CF437, 14CF438, 13CF279, 14CF284.
State has complied with the vicitim notifications.  Victim H. C. of 13CF279 is present in Court today.
Amended Information for 13CF279 is filed in the Court adding Count 5 Battery and add repeater enhancers to each count.
Amended Complaint description information for adding Count 5.
Amended Information for 14CF284 is filed in Court dropping Dangerous Weapon enhancers for each 4 counts and Amending Count 2 from Felony Bail Jumping down to Misd. Bail Jumping and repeater enhancers remain.
Atty Gardner concurs with amendments and waives readings.
________
DA Molepski states the plea agreements.
13CF279 Count 1: I/S Sentence: Prison at 24 mo Incarceration and 36 mo Extended Supervision - Stayed
36 mo Probation:
Conditions:
Defendant not to commit any new crimes. 
1 yr jail with 303 days credit.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Sign releases for Agent.
Restitution TBD.
No contact with victims J.N., A.S., and S.S..
$1,000 fine + costs.
Participate in an Alternative Agression course as approved by the Agent.
13CF279 Added Count 5: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, same conditions as Count 1, $200 + costs.
13CF279 Counts 2, 3, & 4 to be DRI.
-------
14CF284: Amended Count 2:  W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation: Costs. Same conditions.
14CF284: Count 3: I/S Sentence:  90 days jail, consecutive-stayed:  36 mo Probation: $100 + costs.
14CF284: Counts 1 & 4 to be DRI.
_______
14CF437 and 14CF438: to be DRI.
_______
Atty Gardner concurs except for jail credit is believed to be 342 days and may argue that time served in 13CF279 for jail sentence and that probation would be concurrent.
______________________________________________
Court notes that Arraignments need to be done on 14CF437 and 14CF438:
14CF437 and 14CF438: Arraignments are held:
State files Information for each case.
Defendant received copy of each case's information.
Defendant waives reading of each case's information. 
Defendant stand mute for each.
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered by the Court for each case.
________________________
Plea Hearings for 13CF279 & 14CF284.

Plea questionnaire/Agreements are filed, Court reviews, correction as agreed by parties is accepted by the Court.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF279 Counts 1:  No Contest
13CF279 Added Count 5: No Contest

14CF284 Amended Count 2:  No Contest
14CF284 Count 3: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of: 
13CF279 Count 1
13CF279 Added Count  5
14CF284 Amended Count 2
14CF284 Count 3
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

14CF437, 14CF438, 13CF279 Counts 2, 3, & 4, and 14CF284 Counts 1 & 4 are Dismissed and Read In.

DA Molepski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner concurs with joint recommendation and makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests 
342 days credit as a condition of probation as time served and 13CF279 Count 1 requests $500 fine + costs. Bond on file to be applied and extra returned to poster. 
Parties stipulate to 342 days jail credit.
Defendant makes apologetic statements and is in support of the recommendation.

********************************************
By The Court Sentencing:  ***PROBATION***
13CF279:  940.19(2) - Felony Substantial Battery - Count 1:
I/S Sentence: Prison at 2 yrs Incarceration and 2 yrs Extended Supervision - Stayed
3 yrs Probation:
Conditions:
342 days jail with 342 days credit already served.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Sign releases for Agent.
Restitution TBD.  State has 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.
No contact with victims Jared Nease, Shannon Schulist or Amanda Schulist.
Participate in an Alternative Agression course as approved by the Agent.
$500 fine + costs.  Bond to be applied to fines/cost and is not to be applied to restitution - if extra return to poster.

13CF279:  940.19(1) - Misd. Battery - Added Count  5: 
I/S Sentence: 30 days Jail, consecutive to Count 1 - stayed
36 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with the same conditions as Count 1.
Pay fine $200 + costs.

14CF284:  946.49(1)(a) - Misd. Bail Jump - Amended Count 2: 
I/S Sentence: 30 days Jail - stayed, consecutive to 13CF279
36 mo Probation, concurrent 
Comply with the same conditions as state in 13CF279.
Pay costs.

14CF284:  940.19(1)  - Misd. Battery - Count 3: 
I/S Sentence:  90 days jail, consecutive to Count 2 - stayed:  
36 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with the same conditions as state in 13CF279.
Pay fine $100 + costs.
_________
Explaination of Written Determinate sentence is provided.
Appeal rights are stated on the record.
Waiver filed and Court schedules arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF437, 14CF438

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Gardner makes statements.  

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick J Pirtle appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint on both cases 14CF437 and 14CF438.  
Court reviews and sees that the Defendant has had initial appearances.  Defendant states he has not received the complaints yet, but heard of the charges at the last hearing.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

Court ask ADA Knaapen to make sure the complaints are sent over to the Jail for the Defendant.
Defendant to get a hold of his Atty Gardner.

BTC:  Jail is to let Defendant make a call to Atty Gardner
and the clerk to call Atty Gardner to inform him of next date and to contact his client.
12-08-14 at 1:30 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14CF437: $1,000 cash bond on each file 14CF437 and 14CF438.    Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Defendant Patrick J Pirtle appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF437 and 14CF438 are heard for initial today.
  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant states he has Robert Garner for an attorney.
14CF437: $1,000 cash bond on each file 14CF437 and 14CF438.    Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. 
14CF438 -  $1,000 cash bond on each file 14CF438 and 14CF437.    Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. No contact Carl Orlowski.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
